description: A URL which is used to navigate to a web page.
The first name of the email recipient.
The last name of the email recipient.
The full name (first and last) of the email recipient.
The email address of the recipient.
The recipient's job role/position in the organization.
The name of the spoofed sender.
The name of the customer organization.
A spoofed internal email address that appears to come from the customer organization.
A relevant system in the customer organization that relates to the content of the email, i.e., a computer system that needs maintenance.
The customer organization's full address including the building number, street name, suite/building, city, state, and zip code.
The customer organization's primary address information.
The customer organization's secondary address information such as unit or suite.
The state where the customer organization is located.
The city where the customer organization is located.
The zip code corresponding to the customer organization location.
The time of year. This includes summer (June, July, and August), fall (September, October, and November), winter (December, January, and February), and spring (March, April, and May).
The current date written out in full (i.e. March 4th, 2020).
The current date written out in a shortened format (i.e. 12/27/19).
The number corresponding to the current month (1-12 for January-December).
The name of the current month written out fully.
The name of the current month written out as an abbreviation (i.e. Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).
The current year written out in full (i.e. 2020).
The current year written out in a shortened format (i.e. 19 for 2019).
The current day of the week.
A made up name to imitate an employee from the customer organization.
An important event that is relevant to the customer organization and the context of the email.
A timeframe for a task or action to be completed by/occur (i.e. within a week, by the end of the quarter, etc.).
The name of a website to be used in a URL or email address.
An abbreviated form of a phrase, such as a company/organization's name (i.e. CISA for Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency).
A short and striking or memorable phrase used to represent an organization.
A mark to show that something has been written or agreed by the signer.
The subject matter of the email.
An identifying number or string that can represent a service case or temporary password.
An employee program utilized within the customer organization (i.e. a company parking program).
The symbol used to represent the customer organization.
The job/position of a spoof employee.
A number to represent an amount of something.
